title: Warm/neutral hero image + overlay tuning and teal CTA contrast fixes

requirements.text: Update the homepage hero background image to a real-life community collaboration photograph with a warmer/neutral overall color balance, and ensure the hero section renders the updated asset reliably (no stale/cached image on refresh).

quotes: changing the image itself to a warmer, cooler photo... the hero image needs to change to a real life collaboration of community shot.

acceptanceCriteria: Hero background image in the hero section uses the new generated asset (not the prior version) and the image clearly depicts a real-life community collaboration scene.
Refreshing the page (including hard refresh) consistently shows the latest hero image (implement cache-busting via filename change and/or versioned asset reference).
Hero image remains full-bleed and properly cropped (object-cover) across mobile and desktop without distortion.

requirements.text: Refine the hero overlay gradient to shift tint toward warm or neutral tones and adjust overlay opacity so the new photoâ€™s natural colors remain visible while maintaining strong text readability.

quotes: changing... the overlay color, shifting the tint more toward warm or neutral tones and adjusting the opacity affecting the new photos natural colors

acceptanceCriteria: Overlay gradient tint is adjusted away from overly cool/dark rendering and reads as warm/neutral while still fitting the existing civic-teal design language.
Overlay opacity is tuned so the hero photo remains clearly recognizable (not overly obscured), while the hero headline and paragraph remain readable against the full image.
Hero headline and description remain visually legible at common breakpoints (mobile + desktop) without relying on the image being unusually dark.

requirements.text: Fix CTA/button styling issues so the header "Get Started" button is never white text on a white (or near-white) background, and refine CTA buttons to a colorful teal-forward palette consistent with the existing accent tokens and hover/focus states.

quotes: The "Get Started" button is white text on white background
Also refine the buttons with a colorful, possibly teal colored, palate fitting design

acceptanceCriteria: The header "Get Started" button has sufficient contrast between text and background in both light and dark modes (no white-on-white).
Primary CTAs use the existing teal accent styling (accent + accent-hover) with clear hover, active, and focus-visible states.
Button styling remains consistent across the header and hero CTAs (radius, borders, shadows), without introducing ad-hoc raw colors (use existing Tailwind tokens/CSS variables).

constraints: Do not modify files in frontend immutablePaths (e.g., frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/components/ui/*).
Keep all changes within the existing React + Tailwind styling system (use existing tokens like --accent / bg-accent rather than raw hex).
nonGoals: No new navigation/pages or feature additions beyond hero/overlay/button visual refinements.
No changes to Secretary navigation/deep-linking logic.

edits: Adjust white balance toward warm/neutral, improve natural warmth without oversaturation, and keep the scene clearly real-life community collaboration (whisper-hero-community-real-v2.dim_1600x900.png > whisper-hero-community-real-warm-v3.dim_1600x900.png)
